description.para: Calls the AWS Outposts DeleteOutpost API operation.

description.para: The service has not provided documentation for this parameter; please refer to the service's API reference documentation for the latest available information.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.Outposts.Model.DeleteOutpostResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the OutpostId parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^OutpostId' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.
This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

This cmdlet does not generate any output.The service response (type Amazon.Outposts.Model.DeleteOutpostResponse) can be referenced from properties attached to the cmdlet entry in the $AWSHistory stack.
Calls the AWS Outposts ListSites API operation.

copyright.para: © Copyright 2012 - 2020 Amazon.com, Inc.or its affiliates.All Rights Reserved.

description.para:
Lists the sites for the specified AWS account.
This cmdlet automatically pages all available results to the pipeline - parameters related to iteration are only needed if you want to manually control the paginated output. To disable autopagination, use -NoAutoIteration.
The service has not provided documentation for this parameter; please refer to the service's API reference documentation for the latest available information.

The service has not provided documentation for this parameter; please refer to the service's API reference documentation for the latest available information.
Note: This parameter is only used if you are manually controlling output pagination of the service API call.
In order to manually control output pagination, use '-NextToken $null' for the first call and '-NextToken $AWSHistory.LastServiceResponse.NextToken' for subsequent calls.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Sites'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.Outposts.Model.ListSitesResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.Outposts.Model.ListSitesResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.
The service has not provided documentation for this parameter; please refer to the service's API reference documentation for the latest available information.

By default the cmdlet will auto-iterate and retrieve all results to the pipeline by performing multiple service calls. If set, the cmdlet will retrieve only the next 'page' of results using the value of NextToken as the start point.

Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'Sites'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.Outposts.Model.ListSitesResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.Outposts.Model.ListSitesResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

This cmdlet returns a collection of Amazon.Outposts.Model.Site objects. The service call response (type Amazon.Outposts.Model.ListSitesResponse) can also be referenced from properties attached to the cmdlet entry in the $AWSHistory stack.
